item.title: 136 Combat Missions Across Three Wars
item.description: A veteran reflects on flying 136 missions over multiple conflicts, sharing the demands of combat aviation and the experiences gained across decades of service. A respectful, historical account.

item.title: A P-38 Pilot’s Remarkable Survival Story
item.description: A World War II pilot recalls his experiences flying the P-38 and the many close calls he survived. A respectful, factual look at the challenges and dangers of combat aviation.

item.title: Korean War Veterans Remember the Frozen Chosin
item.description: Korean War veterans reflect on the harsh conditions at the Chosin Reservoir and the historic evacuation that helped bring 100,000 refugees to safety. A respectful look at a mission that shaped generations.

item.title: Four Days of Combat and Its Lasting Effects
item.description: A veteran reflects on the difficult conditions faced after days of continuous combat and how it affected basic routines like eating. A respectful, factual look at the realities of wartime experience.

item.description: A Navy corpsman recounts the bravery and sacrifice involved in saving fellow Marines during intense combat in Vietnam, actions that earned him three Purple Hearts.
